input.name: __VIEWSTATE

p.span: Per Governor Wolf's directive, the Avonworth School District will be closed for the remainder fo the 2019-2020 academic school year.
This includes all playgrounds, athletic fields, football stadium, track, and all school grounds.

All athletics, school-related events, and use of school district facilities are cancelled. We will provide updates to our school community as decisions are made regarding this closure. Updates, announcements, information, and resources related to COVID-19 and our District's response can be found here:

strong.span: School Board Meetings will be Held Virtually

p.span: Access information about attending Virtual School Board meetings here:

p.strong:
Governor Wolf Announces the Closure of PA Schools for the Remainder of the 2019-2020 Academic School Year, April 9, 2020
Governor Wolf's Announcement

span.style: font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Important Update Regarding COVID-19 and School Closure
Dear Avonworth Parents and Caregivers,

I want to thank you once again for your incredible support during the school closure. The Avonworth Continuity of Education plan, which is our virtual learning program, has been working very well. This is due to the hard work of all of our school personnel, as well as your continued support and perseverance. We have all pulled together as a school community during this difficult time, and I couldn’t be more proud.

I also recognize that you didn’t choose for your child to be a cyber school student. Likewise, our teachers have shifted their practice to be online teachers, when they gain the most satisfaction from the daily face to face interactions with their students.

While I am committed to the continuation of learning for our students, as this situation continues, I become more and more concerned about the mental health and emotional well-being of our students and families. I am sensitive to the long-term stamina required of our students as the closure stretches on. Therefore, I have consulted with the Avonworth Board of School Directors regarding my recommendation to adjust the school calendar.
The Avonworth School District School Calendar will be adjusted as follows:
The last instructional day for seniors will be Friday, May 2
The final instructional day for all students will be Friday, May 29
Additionally, I’d like to remind you that there are links to resources available on our
that you may find useful if your child is struggling with the life changes and/or the transition to virtual learning that has occurred because of this crisis.

Your building principals will be sending information regarding dates that will pertain to individual school buildings. This will include dates/times for students to clean out lockers, hand in books, technology devices, sports uniforms, as well as a plan for our seniors to commemorate their graduation. Your building principals are also hard at work on determining events that ease the emotional toll that this situation has taken on students. We continue to be sensitive to the need to support our students.
Please stay safe and healthy!
Thomas W. Ralston
Superintendent of Schools
Avonworth School District

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;font-size:16px

p.span: In addition to this school closure,

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;font-size:16px

p.span: the Avonworth School District will be suspending all school-related events indefintely.

span.style: background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;font-size:16px

p.span: This includes all athletic games, practices, and meetings. If the opportunity presents itself, we will do our best to reschedle events. However, at this time, all events are either canceled or postponed.

span.style: background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: The Avonworth School District will continue to monitor this situation closely and will respond immediately to any changes that occur and/or any direction provided by the Allegheny County Health Department, Pennsylvania Department of Health, Pennsylvania Department of Education or Centers for Disease Control.

span.span: To protect yourself and your community, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends the following precautions be taken to reduce the spread of germs.

li.span: Washing hands multiple times a day for at least 20 seconds with soap and water (Use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer if soap and water are not available)
Covering coughs or sneezes with your elbow or use a tissue (Do not use your hands!)
Avoiding touching your eyes, nose and mouth with unwashed hands
Cleaning touch-surfaces frequently, including counter tops, light switches, cell phones and remotes
Encouraging fist and elbow pumps over handshakes and high-fives
Staying home if you are sick and for at least 24 hours after a fever

p.span: Our teachers and nurses continue to reinforce behaviors of good hygiene with our students. Our custodians have increased their efforts by disinfecting surfaces and door knobs on the interior and exterior doors throughout the day.

span.a: Avonworth School District Continuity of Education Plan
